PROVISION OF FREE MID-DAY MEAL TO SCHOOL CHILDREN : DETAILS 2368/12 1.
() , ? asked the Minister of Education Services:
(a) Is he aware that a pledge was made under the Mahinda Chintana - Dinawamu Sri Lanka manifesto, that a meal of rice would be provided free of charge to the school children for their mid day meal?
(i) whether all the students receive the mid-day meal as per the aforesaid pledge;
(iii) the number of schools, that provide a meal of rice for the mid day meal at present; and
(iv) the basis on which the aforesaid schools were selected for the purpose of providing the mid day meal?
(c) If not, why? ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Duminda Dissanayake - Minister of Education Services) , .

SAITM : SAITM PRIVATE MEDICAL COLLEGE: SCHOLARSHIPS
() , ? asked the Minister of Higher Education:
(i) the year in which enrolment of students to follow the Medical degree - MBBS - course was done for the first time by SAITM private medical college situated in Malabe;
(ii) the number of local students registered to follow the said degree course by 30th September, 2013;
(iii) the total course fee to be paid by a student got registered in 2013;
(iv) whether an agreement has been reached on a method of granting scholarships to local students, when this institution was established;
(v) if so, what that agreement is; and
(vi) the number of students who have been granted full scholarships out of the total number of students registered by now?
(b) If not, why? ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Nandimithra Ekanayake - Deputy Minister of Higher Education) , .

: SAMPATHNUWARA VIDYALAYA : PHYSICAL AND HUMAN RESOURCES 2505/12 13. ( ) (The Hon. Sajith Premadasa) - (3) :

(a) Is he aware that there are a number of shortages of physical resources and human resources in Sampathnuwara Vidyalaya situated in the Sampathnuwara Divisional Secretary's Division in the Northern Province?
(i) the shortages of physical and human resources that exist in Sampathnuwara Vidyalaya;
(ii) whether action will be taken to remedy the aforesaid shortages; and
(iii) if so, of the time taken for that?

asked the Minister of Petroleum Industries:
(a) Will he state, pertaining to the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation -
(i) the profit or loss from 2012 to date;
(ii) the profit or loss projected for the years 2015-2016;
(iii) the capital and reserves as at today;
(iv) the number of people working in the institution;
(v) whether it is overstaffed or understaffed;
(vi) the cost per employee and profit per employee; and
(vii) the total of short term debt along with the bank overdrafts, medium and long term debts as at today?

( ) (The Deputy Speaker) The Hon. Minister will read out the Answer only if he is willing to do so. : : PADDY LANDS IN AKURESSA DIVISIONAL SECRETARY'S DIVISION: UNAUTHORIZED FILLING
3. ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. John Amaratunga on behalf of the Hon. Buddhika Pathirana) - (1):
( ) , ? asked the Minister of Economic Development:

(a) Will he inform this House - (i) whether it is known that people level accusations to the effect that the paddy lands in the Akuressa Divisional Secretary's Division are being filled; (ii) the extent of paddy lands in that Divisional Secretary's Division, that has been filled without permission from the year 2005 up to now; (iii) whether complaints have been received against the aforesaid unauthorized fillings; (iv) if so, the number of complaints received; (v) whether action has been taken according to the law after conducting investigations into the aforesaid complaints; and (vi) the courses of action taken accordingly?
(i) whether legal permission has been obtained to reclaim the paddy lands in the Akuressa Divisional Secretary's Division from the year 2005 up to now;
(ii) if so, the extent of paddy lands for which permission has been granted to be reclaimed; and
(iii) the reasons for granting permission to reclaim the aforesaid paddy lands?
(c) If not, why? .. ( ) ( .. - ) (The Hon. S.M. Chandrasena - Minister of Special Projects and Deputy Minister of Economic Development) , * .
NEW TERMINAL OF COLOMBO SOUTH HARBOUR: DETAILS
6. ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. John Amaratunga on behalf of the Hon. Tissa Attanayake) , - (2):
asked the Minister of Highways, Ports and Shipping:
(a) Will he inform this House of -
(i) the amount of funds spent on the construction of the New Terminal or the Abhimantota Terminal of the Colombo South Harbour;
(ii) the funding source of the above construction project;
(iii) the date on which an agreement was made with the Chinese company for constructing this terminal; and
(iv) the conditions agreed to on that occasion?
(b) Will he also inform this House -
(i) whether there is any truth in the reports published to the effect that the aforesaid new terminal has been leased out to the China Merchant Holding Hong Kong Company for 35 years, until 2048;
(ii) if so, of the conditions of lease, the manner of income distribution and the ways in which the operations and duties are carried out; and
(iii) whether he admits that the port operations are privatized by leasing out the harbour in this manner, which was a national economic centre?
: : AVIC INTERNATIONAL HOTELS LANKA LIMITED : PURCHASE OF LANDS 4585/13 10. ( () ) ( - () ) (The Hon. John Amaratunga on behalf of the Hon. (Dr.) Harsha De Silva) - (1):
() (i) (Avic International Hotels Lanka Ltd) ` ' (show Wallace and Hedges) 200 ;
() , ? asked the Minister of Finance and Planning:

(a) Is he aware that the Government proposed a ban on the sale of private lands to foreigners and/or foreign companies in the 2013 Budget and the same was reiterated by the Budget Proposal for the year 2014?

(b) Will he state - (i) whether a Chinese company by the name of Avic International Hotels Lanka Limited or a connected party has purchased a block of land over 200 perches bordering Galle Road from Shaw Wallace and Hedges or an entity connected to the same; (ii) whether the same company has also either purchased or taken on long lease approximately 50 perches of land in close proximity to the above land from the Urban Development Authority; and (iii) whether the taxes, stamp duties or any other levy were paid by the Avic International Hotels Lanka Limited or connected party to the Government of Sri Lanka?
: : AGROCHEMICALS OF CEYLON PETROLEUM CORPORATION : METHOD OF DISTRIBUTION 4745/14
12. ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. John Amaratunga on behalf of the Hon. Ashok Abeysinghe) - (1):
asked the Minister of Petroleum Industries:
(i) whether there is an agrochemicals branch under the purview of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation;
(ii) the method of distributing the agrochemicals produced at that branch;
(iii) whether warehouse facilities are available for that branch;
(iv) whether he is aware of the fact that expired agrochemicals are stored in those warehouses; and
(v) the measures that will be taken in relation to those expired agrochemicals?
15. ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. John Amaratunga on behalf of the Hon. Buddhika Pathirana) - (1):
asked the Minister of Postal Services:
(a) Is he aware of the fact that a competitive examination was held in the year 2012 to make recruitments for the post of Postal Officer of Category b, Grade I b of the Integrated Postal Service?
(i) the qualifications of recruitment for the aforesaid post;
(ii) the number of candidates who passed the examination held in order to make the aforesaid recruitments;
(iii) out of the candidates passed, the number of individuals who have been recruited by now;
(iv) the minimum mark that was considered when they were recruited;

(v) the institutions that issued acceptable certificates to certify their computer literacy, in addition to the marks obtained at the competitive examination that was held to select the qualified candidates?

(i) whether he is aware of the fact that the candidates level allegations that, at the time that the recruitments of Postal Officers were made, appointments have been given on friendly basis, depriving the ones who had got higher marks;
(ii) if so, whether actions will be taken to carry out a formal inquiry and to make appointments to those who underwent injustice; and
(iii) if so, of the aforesaid date?
(d) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena) , * .
( ) (The Deputy Speaker) . .[ ] Yes, Hon. Leader of the Opposition.
( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe - Leader of the Opposition) , , , .

Hon. Deputy Speaker, there is another matter that I would like to bring to the notice of the House. On the 31st of May last year, the then Prime Minister of Thailand, Yingluck Shinawatra, addressed this House. The Leader of the House and I, both got up and thanked her.

According to what has happened recently, even after having won an election, not only has she been debarred from contesting, but the Government has been removed; a military government has come in and she has been detained in a military facility.

As a person whom this House has invited to come and address, we have all the right to ask that she be released. After all, her's is a family which has come to this country to ensure that the Upasampada Ceremony between Thailand and Sri Lanka is observed. She came last year in respect of that.

We can insist and we should insist that she be released and the interim government be put back, and free and fair elections be held. You cannot just let them come, take over governments and throw the others away. We are not for that and certainly, she as a person who came to this House and commanded the respect of both the Government and the Opposition. I would get up here and
say that we have all the right to demand that she be released and free and fair elections be held in Thailand.

, , 1994 . , . , . [6.20 p.m.] ... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) Bismillahir Rahmanir Raheem.
Mr. Deputy Chairman of Committees, I rise in this House today to express my deepest sorrow on behalf of
the Muslim community on a great figure who has left the world, leaving behind an indelible mark in the history of this legislature and the country.

I recall with nostalgic memory the Hon. Berty Premalal Dissanayakes services to the Muslim community in Rajarata including both Anuradhapura and Polonnaruwa. When the Mohideen Jumma Mosque was being built in the Anuradhapura town which was a modern building in the style of the great Cordoba architecture in Spain and Al-Medina-al-Munawwara in the Holy City of the Prophet, it was the Hon. Berty Premalal Dissanayake who gave all assistance. He was such a beneficial person. Even today the Chief Trustee of this Mosque, Alhaj M.S.M Fowsi who owns the Zam Zam Stores in the Anuradhapura town speaks so high of him. Also, Sir, he helped in the development of the Zahira College in Anuradhapura. There are several other Muslim schools in Kalawewa, Mihintale, Medawachchiya, Horawpatana and Kekirawa, which mostly benefited through his benevolence.

Rajarata has seen some of the greatest leaders of this country like the late Hon. Maithripala Senanayake. He had been acting as Prime Minister 19 times in this country. It is a record which cannot be broken so easily. Then, we had the late Hon. K.B. Ratnayake, who served as a distinguished Speaker of Parliament. These two gentlemen brought about a great revival to Rajarata. They both helped bridge the gaps between people of the North and the South. They both were educated in Jaffna and they spoke the Tamil language very fluently. Following their footsteps, the Hon. Berty Premalal Dissanayake also helped the Muslim and the Tamil communities. I know, Sir, he always carried in his memory the thoughts of the "Dutugamunu-Elara" battle. Though Dutugamunu fought a battle with Elara, Dutugamunu revered the memories of Ellalan or Elara. Likewise, the Hon. Berty Premalal Dissanayake also harped no ill-will with other communities; he never wanted to hurt other communities.

Sir, I have this book with me, " " by Thiruvalluvar, the greatest classical poet. Whenever we visited the Chief Minister's residence, his beloved wife, Mrs. Jayani Tissera Dissanayake entertained us with great hospitality. When I first met Duminda at his home, he was a tiny tot. Even today I call him "Putha" affectionately. This is what "Thirukkural" states about "" - :
So, to what estimation should we pay tribute to the great qualities of hospitality of that great man, the Hon.

Berty Premalal Dissanayake? I must express my deep sense of gratitude to him because when I was the Minister of Muslim Affairs, we organized the National Meelad-un-Nabi celebration and earlier a programme for the 1400th year of the revelation of the Holy Quran and celebration Hijra in Anuradhapura, and he was very helpful to us in making those events a success. At that time, the late Hon. K.B. Ratnayake was the most senior politician but Mr. Berty Premalal Dissanayake was able to feed our people and help our people. He brought about great rejuvenation even in the lives of the Muslim community in Rajarata. Therefore, I would like to express in this august Assembly our deepest condolences on behalf of the Muslim community. He served in this House for 10 years and 01 month. He was a colourful figure. May he attain Nibbana!
Thank you. [.. 6.25] ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Duminda Dissanayake - Minister of Education Services) , , , . 28 . , , .
( ) (Mr. Deputy Chairman of Committees) I wish to associate myself with the sentiments expressed by both sides of the House on the death of the

Hon. Berty Premalal Dissanayake, ex-Member of Parliament. I shall direct the Secretary-General of Parliament to make a Minute of the Proceedings of todays Meeting and send a copy thereof to the members of the bereaved family.
